info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 06 at 6:32PM CST until March 06 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN BENTON...SOUTHERN DELAWARE...SOUTHEASTERN MAYES... NORTHWESTERN ADAIR AND NORTHERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES... At 632 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Twin Oaks, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Tahlequah... Jay... Gravette... Decatur... Colcord... Kansas... Oaks... Maysville... Peggs... Rose... Hiwasse... Leach... Scraper... Twin Oaks... Lake Eucha State Park... Cherokee City... Natural Falls State Park... Lost City... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
